title: Help me ID logo fonts for each classification type.
content:
Hi, I’m working on my final exam for a typography course, I have to show an example of a logo with each classification type. Right now I’m “stuck”, I can’t find anymore logos to show as an example and thats why I decided to post over here for help. The logos need to be very well known, like coca cola, google, etc… because I live in chile and the logo needs to be known over here.

I also have my doubts regarding some logos I have, I don’t know what font they are or in what category of the classification they belong, thats why I added an attachment with the logos in case anyone could ID them.

Could you help me?

so far I have:  
-venetian: Chivas Regal, berkeley old style  
-Garalde: ??  
-Transitional: ??  
-Didone: Calvin Klein, bodoni  
Slab Serif: m&m, rockwell

Sans Serif  
- Grotesk: government of chile logo  
- Neo-grotesk: Toyota  
- Geometric: ??  
- Humanist: Saab

Blackletter  
- Textura: ??  
- Rotunda: ??  
- Schwabacher: ??  
- Fraktur: Corona?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [examples.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=examples.jpg) | 113.16 KB |
author: jo kelly

comments.content:
did I bother anyone with my questions?

If so I’m sorry, I was only asking because everyone seems so knowledgable in this forum…

Geometric: Calvin Klein

Garalde: maybe Barneys New York?

Banco de Chile (and Corona) are Textura  
Kunstmann is a Fraktur (I think)  
Nivea is a Geometric  
Nestlé is a Neo-grotesk  
whiskas is a Wedge Serif  
Ripley is a Garalde  
Most logos are not a direct use of a font but adaptations or drawn from scratch based on styles.  
If you want to understand the classification and see samples you could visit here  
 [http://www.fontscape.com/explore?8C8](http://web.archive.org/web/20060203085600/http:/www.fontscape.com/explore?8C8)

Tim

Thank you so much!!

Everyone has been so helpful. I’ll check the links as soon as I finish this reply. =)
